channel.title: Loading the RS World list
channel.description:
Im trying to load the rs world list in my bot. But i cant get it working. Im trying to read this page:
http://www.runescape.com/slj.ws?lores.x=1&plugin=0&order=WMLPA
The source isnt being found, i think? Can anyone help me out. Thanks.

item.title: Loading the RS World list
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

Why would you use a 3rd party program to get the worldlist, when it’s far easier to just get them yourselves (and with player information)

Read full topic

item.title: Loading the RS World list
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

_cake:

The binary world list is simply the html world list but instead he’s using bitwise stuff to figure stuff out.

You have such a way with words.

BAsh(CntLgn):

I don’t think the players >= 1980 should be there. It should be up to the random world selector to return a world that is not full and code requesting a specific world to check to see if it is full.

I just copied what was in the client, think what you wish

Read full topic

item.title: Loading the RS World list
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

I don’t think the players >= 1980 should be there. It should be up to the random world selector to return a world that is not full and code requesting a specific world to check to see if it is full.

Read full topic

item.title: Loading the RS World list
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

The binary world list is simply the html world list but instead he’s using bitwise stuff to figure stuff out.

private static void readWorldList(URL u, LoaderContext.Language l) throws IOException { URLConnection uc = u.openConnection(); DataInputStream dis = new DataInputStream(uc.getInputStream()); Map<Integer, World> m = new HashMap<Integer, World>(); dis.readInt(); int entryCount = dis.readUnsignedShort(); for (int i = 0; i < entryCount; i++) { int k = (dis.readByte() << 8 & 0xff00) + (0xff & dis.readByte()); boolean members = (k & 0x8000) != 0; int worldid = (k & 0x7fff); String prefix = readString(dis); int players = (dis.readByte() << 8 & 0xff00) + (0xff & dis.readByte()); if (players > 32767) players -= 65535; if (players >= 1980 || players == 1 || players == -1) continue; m.put(worldid, new World(prefix, worldid, players, members)); } dis.close(); WORLDS.put(l, m); }

Read full topic

item.title: Loading the RS World list
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

Or like BAsh said, you could look at the source for my loader xD
It loads the binary worldlist (instead of the HTML one), and so it consumes less bandwidth and loads faster

item.title: Loading the RS World list
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Moparisthebest:

What are you using to read that page? You want it not to run javascript, and make sure you send the correct headers.

If you use the javascript version, you can get more information by parsing the javascript, I believe.

Read full topic
